channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tim Walz Departs on a Deluge of Fraud
item.description: The Minnesota governor was brought down by the consequences of his own irresponsible profligacy.

item.title: WATCH: Hegseth touts U.S military strength while swearing in new recruits
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth touts the strength of the U.S. military during the Venezuela intervention while swearing in new recruits in Virginia.

item.title: Air traffic still runs on floppy discs in places, so the FAA just picked 2 companies for a $26 billion radar overhaul
item.description: The FAA has been spending most of its $3 billion equipment budget just maintaining the fragile old system.

item.title: Mamdani admits he has no federal security clearance after claiming he was 'briefed' on Venezuela raid
item.description: NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani admitted he lacks security clearance after saying he was "briefed" on Nicolas Maduro's capture this weekend.

item.title: Republican congressman hospitalized after car accident, sources say
item.description: Rep. Jim Baird hospitalized after car accident, reported in stable condition. Indiana Republican congressman remains responsive following the incident...

item.title: Felon Milwaukee County Judge Resigns With Guaranteed Pension
item.description: A federal jury last month convicted Hannah Dugan of obstructing ICE agents attempting to arrest an illegal immigrant.

item.title: Beijing’s Long Game Meets Washington’s Gamble
item.description: Venezuela has become a proving ground for the emerging world order.

item.title: Hegseth: America’s Military Is ‘Already Surpassing’ Last Year’s Recruiting Figures
item.description: 'We're setting new records at the War Department of historic recruitment of men and women wanting to join the ranks,' said War Secretary Pete Hegseth.

item.title: Trump’s Ukraine peace plan endangered by his launch of a new war in the western hemisphere, saber rattling over Greeland
item.description: Leaders of Ukraine’s allies gathered Tuesday in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country’s security after any potential peace deal.

item.title: House GOP Rep Doug LaMalfa dead at 65
item.description: California Congressman Doug LaMalfa has passed away at age 65.

item.title: California GOP Rep. Doug LaMalfa dies at 65
item.description: California GOP Rep. Doug LaMalfa has died at age 65, a top Republican said Tuesday.

item.title: Republicans rally behind Trump's military strike to arrest Maduro as Democrats sound alarm: poll
item.description: A new poll reveals a sharp partisan divide over Trump's military operation leading to the capture of Venezuelan leader Nicholas Maduro on drug traffic...

item.title: Pizza plummeted on the list of Americans’ favorite take-out options as they opt for more nutrient-dense slop bowls from Uber Eats
item.description: Even when customers choose pizza, they tend to get smaller pies and fewer toppings, said Papa John’s executives.

item.title: After Making Money On ‘America 250,’ The NFL Will Go Back To Hating The USA
item.description: Any patriotism on display by the NFL over the next few months will be, at best, a bait and switch.

item.title: National Rifle Association sues its charitable foundation, alleging takeover by 'disgruntled' ex-board members
item.description: Former NRA directors accused of seizing control of charitable foundation to compete with gun rights group after losing board power amid scandals.

item.title: Trump Mobile has been accepting $100 deposits for a golden phone but the prototype is nowhere to be seen as CES kicks off
item.description: Trump Mobile initially hailed T1 as a device that would be “proudly designed and built in the United States for customers who expect the best."

item.title: Meet an Oregon cafe where American Sign Language is the default way to order
item.description: The cafe — owned by CymaSpace, a nonprofit that makes art accessible to the Deaf community — also hosts weekly ASL meetups and game nights.

item.title: What to Do with California’s Billionaire Tax Proceeds
item.description: A health-care union’s ‘one-time fix’ for federal Medicaid cuts could easily become permanent.
